clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Patient Education Videos on Perioperative Anxiety in Patients Undergoing Endoscopic Sinus Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Patient Education Videos on Perioperative Anxiety in Patients Undergoing

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic rhinosinusitis treatment consists of medical management and surgical intervention. Improving patient education can positively impact perioperative patient experiential outcomes such as anxiety, pain and satisfaction. However, online education materials are often too complex, inaccurate or misleading. The objective of this study was to determine if patient education videos at an appropriate reading level would improve perioperative anxiety in patients undergoing endoscopic sinus surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Measured with State Trait Anxiety Inventory (range 20-80, higher score shows higher anxiety)
Visual Analogue Scale (1-10, higher score means higher anxiety)

secondary_outcome.description: Measured with State Trait Anxiety Inventory (range 20-80, higher score shows higher anxiety)
Visual Analogue Scale (1-10, higher score means higher anxiety)
Measured via Visual Analogue Scale (1-10, higher score means worse pain)
Measured via Visual Analogue Scale (1-10, higher score means better satisfaction)
Measured via frequency of nasal irrigation per day

arm_group.description: Standard of care patient education with verbal and written education
Patient education supplemented with four short youtube videos regarding chronic rhinosinusitis and endoscopic sinus surgery

intervention.description: Patients receive four short YouTube videos explaining chronic rhinosinusitis and endoscopic sinus surgery
Standard patient education with verbal and written education

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older
- English speaking
- diagnosed with CRS according to Canadian Guidelines
- computer or mobile phone access were included
Exclusion Criteria:
- immunocompromised
- had sinonasal tumours
- history of anxiety, depression, bipolar, or any other mental illnesses
